sen.j: 私鋳銭（しちゅうせん）とは、政府が作った公の銭ではなく、私的に偽造された銭のこと。
sen.e: Shichusen refers to privately produced counterfeit money, which is differentiated from the official money coined by the government.
Shichusen refers to privately produced counterfeit money, as differentiated from the official money coined by the government.
Shichusen refers to privately produced counterfeit money, as differentiated from the official money coined by the government.

sen.j: 奈良時代から平安時代にかけては、皇朝十二銭が公の銭であったが、広く私鋳銭が使われていた。
sen.e: Despite the fact that Kocho-Junisen (twelve coins casted in Japan) was the official money during the Nara and Heian Periods, shichusen was widely used.
Despite the fact that Kocho-Junisen (twelve coins casted in Japan) was the official money during the Nara and Heian Periods, shichusen was widely used.
Despite the fact that Kocho-Junisen (12 coins casted in Japan) was the official money during the Nara and Heian periods, shichusen was widely used.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降は更に宋銭の私鋳銭などが盛んに作られ、室町時代中後期には最盛期を迎えた（なお、宋銭などの渡来銭そのものも当時の日本の朝廷が発行した銭ではないという意味では私鋳銭と同様であった。
sen.e: During and after the Kamakura periods, shichusen of Sung currency was also actively made, and it reached its peak during the mid to late Muromachi period (it should be noted, however, that imported Sung currency itself was considered equivalent to shichusen, since it was not money issued by the Japanese imperial court, and therefore could not be considered as official money.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During and after the Kamakura period, shichusen of Sung currency was also actively minted, and it reached its peak during the mid to late Muromachi period (it should be noted, however, that imported Sung currency itself was considered equivalent to shichusen, since it was not money issued by the Japanese imperial court, and therefore could not be considered official money.

During and after the Kamakura period, shichusen of Sung currency was also actively minted, and it reached its peak during the mid to late Muromachi period (it should be noted, however, that imported Sung currency itself was considered equivalent to shichusen, since it was not money issued by the Japanese imperial court, and therefore could not be considered official money).
sen.cmt: かっこを補足しました。

sen.j: 朝廷や鎌倉幕府によって使用禁止令が出されたこともある（「宋銭禁止令」））。
sen.e: It is known that the imperial court and the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) issued the ban against the use of Sung currency ("Sosen kinshirei")).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is known that the imperial court and the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) issued a ban against the use of Sung currency ("Sosen kinshirei")).
It is known that the imperial court and the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) issued a ban against the use of Sung currency ['Sosen kinshirei']).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: また、劣悪な質の私鋳銭などの流通により、撰銭などが発生した。
sen.e: The circulation of the extremely poor quality shichusen also led to erizeni (selecting refined coins).
The circulation of the extremely poor quality shichusen also led to erizeni (selecting refined coins).
The circulation of the extremely poor quality shichusen also led to erizeni (selecting refined coins).

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると幕府は寛永通宝の流通を始め貨幣政策を強化したため、私鋳銭は徐々に姿を消していった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, however, as the bakufu enforced its policy on currency by starting to circulate Kanei Tsuho coins, shichusen gradually disappeared.
In the Edo period, however, as the bakufu enforced its policy on currency by starting to circulate Kanei Tsuho coins, shichusen gradually disappeared.
In the Edo period, however, as the bakufu enforced its policy on currency by starting to circulate Kanei Tsuho coins, shichusen gradually disappeared.

sen.j: 私鋳銭を製造するには、種銭と呼ばれる銭を型に鋳型を造る。
sen.e: In order to produce shichusen, the mold is made using tanesen (the original coin) as the matrix.
In order to produce shichusen, a mold is made by using tanesen (the original coin) as the matrix.
In order to produce shichusen, a mold is made by using tanesen (the original coin) as the matrix.

sen.j: この種銭の善し悪しが私鋳銭の品質を大きく左右する。
sen.e: The quality of shichusen produced greatly depends on the quality of this tanesen.
The quality of shichusen produced greatly depends on the quality of this tanesen.
The quality of shichusen produced greatly depends on the quality of this tanesen.

sen.j: また、鋳型は繰り返し使用するうちに傷み、次第に銭影がぼやけ、銭名が読めなくなる。
sen.e: After the repeated use of molds, they become damaged, and what is impressed on the coins become illegible due to the gradual wear of the impression of the original coin.
After repeated use of molds, they become damaged, and the impressions on the coins become illegible due to the gradual wear of the impression of the original coin.
After repeated use of molds, they become damaged, and the impressions on the coins become illegible due to the gradual wear of the impression of the original coin.

sen.j: 原材料は輸入した本銭に鉄などを混ぜて融解して用いた。
sen.e: Molten iron mixed with imported coins was used as the raw materials.
Molten iron mixed with imported coins was used as the raw material.
Molten iron mixed with imported coins was used as the raw material.

sen.j: 鎌倉、堺市、博多などで私鋳銭の工房跡が発掘調査されている。
sen.e: In Kamakura, Sakai City, and Hakata, researches on the lands where the remains of factories of shichusen were found have been conducted.
In Kamakura, Sakai City, and Hakata, research has been conducted on the lands where the remains of factories of shichusen were found.
In Kamakura, Sakai City, and Hakata, research has been conducted on the lands where the remains of factories of shichusen were found.

sen.j: 私鋳銭は、和同開珎が鋳造（708年）された直後から製造、流通していたと考えられ、翌年（709年）には早くも私鋳を禁ずる詔が出された。
sen.e: It is thought that shichusen started to be produced and circulated just after Wado-kaichin silver coins were coined in 708, and the official ban against shichusen was issued in the following year of 709.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is thought that shichusen started to be produced and circulated just after Wado-kaichin silver coins were coined in 708, and an official ban against shichusen was issued in the following year of 709.

It is thought that shichusen started to be produced and circulated just after Wado-kaichin silver coins were coined in 708, and an official ban against shichusen was issued in the following year of 709.

sen.j: 同時に、私鋳を行った者に対して官位剥奪、杖罪などを適用されることが規定されたが私鋳は止まず、後に首謀者に対する刑は死罪 (律令法)に引き上げられている。
sen.e: Although the law to strip of the court ranks of those who carried out the act of shichusen and to give them a flogging was also laid down at the same time as the issuing of the ban, production of shichusen did not stop, and in later years, the punishment for the ringleader of the crime had gotten more and more severe to the point which the death penalty was sentenced to the criminals under the Ritsuryo code of law.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although the law to strip the court ranks of those who carried out the act of shichusen and to give them a flogging was also laid down at the same time the ban the issued, production of shichusen did not stop, and in later years, the punishment given to the ringleader of the crime became more and more severe to the point where the death penalty was given to the criminals under the Ritsuryo code of law.

Although the law to strip the court ranks of those who carried out the act of shichusen and to give them a flogging was also laid down at the same time the ban the issued, production of shichusen did not stop, and in later years, the punishment given to the ringleader of the crime became more and more severe to the point where the death penalty was given to the criminals under the Ritsuryo code of law.

sen.j: 私鋳銭の製造は極めて重い罪に位置づけられ、恩赦などの対象からも外される事例も見られた。
sen.e: Production of shichusen was considered an extremely serious crime, as in some cases, the producers of shichusen were not included when the pardon was granted.
Production of shichusen was considered an extremely serious crime, as in some cases, the producers of shichusen were not included when pardons were granted.
